newsitem.title: LATVIA: SHARES STUCK IN MIDSUMMER DOLDRUMS.
newsitem.headline: SHARES STUCK IN MIDSUMMER DOLDRUMS.

text.p: * Latvia's struggling share market was still mired in the midsummer doldrums on Thursday in paltry turnover of 39,000 lats against 33,000 lats on Wednesday.
* On the official list, three stocks eased, one held steady and only Kaija fish cannery gained, inching up 0.9 percent to 2.19 lats.
* The Rietumu index shed 0.12 percent to 153.17 while the bourse index fell 0.32 percent to 382.96.
No red rags were in sight on Latvia's sluggish bourse on Thursday and dealers did not expect the bears to hibernate before the fall.
Turnover was a paltry 39,000 lats and the bourse index eased 0.32 percent to 382.96.
Three of the five official list stocks eased with only the Kaija fish factory gaining ground. It inched up to 2.17 lats from 2.15 lats in trade of 2,200 lats.
Unibanka held steady at 3.35 lats in trade of 8,400 lats.
Dealers said the market was still wallowing after the four-day midsummer weekend.
It has also suffered from longer term factors.

Lacking big insitutional investors and largely insulated from trends elsewhere in the region and Europe, the market has failed to pull forcefully from a slump which set in after a January bull-run that analysts say was speculative.
The money that is out there is mostly being channeled into privatisation vouchers ahead of a spate of sell-offs of key state enterprises, dealers said.
"The vouchers will suck in a lot of the money, away from the bourse, until at least September," said one dealer.
On a brighter note, dealers said the official list seemed to be stabilising despite the session's losses.
"The official list appears to have stabilised," said Andreta Petersone, a broker with Hansabank-Latvija.
"The Riga Transport Fleet (RTF) is down a bit, but its half-year results are expected to be good, so it shouldn't fall much more," she said.
RTF shed 3.3 percent to 1.19 lats on Thursday in trade of 2,500 lats.
